gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class Sentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.Sentence

  • public class Sentence
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a sentence, a list of which form a Document. A sentence consists of words (tokens) and is associated with a parse tree and syntactic dependencies that hold between its words.

    As the processing progresses, the word list is transformed into a list of textual units (SurfaceElements) and the dependency list is transformed into a list of embeddings, which are essentially semantically-informed modifications to the original word list and dependencies, respectively. The original word and dependency list is maintained separately. The list of transformations the sentence has gone through are kept track of.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • getSurfaceElementsFromSpan

        public java.util.List<SurfaceElement> getSurfaceElementsFromSpan(Span sp)
        Finds the textual units that are covered (fully or partially) by a given span
        Parameters:
        sp - the span that is considered
        Returns:
        the list of textual units in span, empty list if no such textual units exist

      • getSurfaceElementsFromSpan

        public java.util.List<SurfaceElement> getSurfaceElementsFromSpan(SpanList sp)
        Similar to getSurfaceElementsFromSpan(Span), takes in a span list as input.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span to consider
        Returns:
        the list of textual units in the span list, empty list if no such textual units exist

      • getWordsInSpan

        public java.util.List<Word> getWordsInSpan(Span sp)
        Similar to getSurfaceElementsFromSpan(Span), but returns individual tokens instead of textual units.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span to consider
        Returns:
        the list of words in the span, empty list if no words are found

      • getWordsInSpan

        public java.util.List<Word> getWordsInSpan(SpanList sp)
        Similar to getSurfaceElementsFromSpan(SpanList), but returns individual tokens instead of textual units.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span list to consider
        Returns:
        the list of words in the span list, empty list if no words are found

      • getStringInSpan

        public java.lang.String getStringInSpan(Span sp)
        Finds the text in the given span.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span that is considered
        Returns:
        the string in the span, empty string if the sentence does not cover the span

      • getStringInSpan

        public java.lang.String getStringInSpan(SpanList sp)
        Similar to getStringInSpan(Span), but it takes a span list as input. SpanList#SEPARATOR is used as the delimiter.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span list that is considered
        Returns:
        the string in the span list, empty string if the sentence does not cover the span list

      • getNextSurfaceElement

        public SurfaceElement getNextSurfaceElement(SurfaceElement surf)
        Finds the textual unit that follows surf.
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        the textual unit that follows surf or null, if it is the last textual unit of the sentence

      • getPrecedingWord

        public Word getPrecedingWord(Word word)
        Finds the token that precedes word.
        Parameters:
        word - a token
        Returns:
        the token that precedes word or null, if it is the first word of the sentence

        Finds the token that follows word.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getPrecedingSurfaceElement

        public SurfaceElement getPrecedingSurfaceElement(SurfaceElement surf)
        Finds the textual unit that precedes surf.
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        the textual unit that precedes surf or null, if it is the first textual unit of the sentence

      • getLexemes

        public java.util.List<WordLexeme> getLexemes()
        Returns:

      • getSubsumingSurfaceElement

        public SurfaceElement getSubsumingSurfaceElement(SpanList sp)
        Finds the textual unit that fully covers the specified span list.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span list to consider
        Returns:
        the textual unit that covers the span, if any, otherwise null.

      • getSpansWithText

        public SpanList getSpansWithText(java.lang.String t,
                                 boolean allowSubMatch)
        Gets all spans of a given text in this sentence. It does not check whether parts of an instance correspond to the same textual unit or not.
        Parameters:
        t - the text to check for
        allowSubMatch - whether to allow matches with token substrings
        Returns:
        a SpanList object containing the span of each instance, null if none found

      • synchSurfaceElements

        public void synchSurfaceElements(SurfaceElement si)
        Updates the textual unit information of this sentence with a new (probably newly-created) SurfaceElement.

        It has no knowledge of the syntactic dependencies involved, so it's best to run this with #synchEmbeddings(List, List) with a list of dependencies to remove or add.

        Parameters:
        si - a new textual unit

      • splitSurfaceElements

        public void splitSurfaceElements(SurfaceElement si,
                                 java.util.List<SurfaceElement> replacements)
        Splits an existing textual unit into smaller chunks. The elements of replacements variable are expected to be in span order and fully subsume the textual unit.

        It has no knowledge of the syntactic dependencies involved, so it's best to run this with #synchEmbeddings(List, List) with a list of dependencies to remove or add.

        Parameters:
        si - an existing textual unit
        replacements - the replacing textual units

      • synchEmbeddings

        public void synchEmbeddings()
        Updates embedding dependencies to make sure that they reflect the latest textual unit list.

        If the embedding list has not been initialized, it will try to initialize it to the original dependency list. New dependencies may be added.

      • synchEmbeddings

        public void synchEmbeddings(java.util.List<SynDependency> remove,
                            java.util.List<SynDependency> add)
        Similar to synchEmbeddings(), but takes as argument explicit lists of dependencies to remove/add.
        Parameters:
        remove - the list of dependencies to remove
        add - the list of dependencies to add

      • mergeSpansIfPossible

        public SpanList mergeSpansIfPossible(SpanList sp)
        Creates a single SpanList from one that may contain individual Span objects corresponding to adjacent words
        Parameters:
        sp - the input span list
        Returns:
        the single merged span list

      • logTransformation

        public void logTransformation(java.lang.String type)
        Logs transformed syntactic dependencies of this sentence.
        Parameters:
        type - the transformation name to write to log

      • toXml

        public nu.xom.Element toXml()
        Creates an XML representation of this sentence.
        Returns:
        an XML representation of this sentence
